Name: Saxon England
Weaknesses: Lack cavalry and good ranged troop.

Name: New Kingdom
Strengths: Well-balanced army with the support from auxiliaries of variety.

Name: Canaan Alliance
Strengths: Strong chariot and numerous affordable infantries.

Name: Ottoman Empire
Strengths: Unparalleled combination of old and new warfare in one army.

Name: Kingdom of Hungary
Strengths: Unmatched cavalries of both heavy and light.
Weaknesses: Field only defensive infantries that require support.

Name: Kingdom of Poland
Strengths: Good combination of infantry and cavalry forces.

Name: Papal State
Weaknesses: Poor choices of cavalry come only from auxiliary sources.

Name: Holy Roman Empire
Strengths: Strong and heavy army with no glaring weakness.
Weaknesses: Not extremely strong in any specific compartment.

Name: Kingdom of Croatia
Weaknesses: No particularly powerful heavy troops for a frontal offensive.

Name: Lands of the Bohemian Crown
Strengths: Mobile and effective combination of infantry and artillery force.

Name: Duchy of Brittany
Strengths: Specialised in cavalry force and skirmish tactic.
Weaknesses: No specialised infantry for melee combat.

Name: Kingdom of France
Weaknesses: No proper skirmishing cavalries and infantries.

Name: European Mercenary
Weaknesses: Cavalry mercenaries are a rare sight on battlefield.
